release.action: Fix behaviour for Joda LocalDate with some historical (and potentially future) dates where timezone changes occurred. Issue and resolution proposed by Paul Middelkoop
Fix behaviour where a manually set default Joda DateTimeZone is ignored. See http://jira.grails.org/browse/GPJODATIME-25

Renamed module from usertype.jsr310 to usertype.extended
Global registration of configuration parameters
Auto registration of user types. Based on suggestion by Dominic domi1980@gmail.com
Added support for Joda Time 2's MonthDay type
Added support for Joda Time 2's YearMonth type
Added support for Joda Money 0.6
Renamed the Legacy JDK Temporal Usertype classes
Updated to Hibernate 4.0.1 Final
Initial release supporting Hibernate 4. Thanks for initial patch from Matt Drees.

Support @Version functionality
Allow usertype properties to be dereferenced in queries
Usertype classes are now serializable
Fix compatibility with the Hibernate 3.6 jar in Maven central
For JSR-310 restored the Joda Time roundtrip tests now Joda Time Contrib supports Hibernate 3.6

release.description: Custom Handling of Database and JVM timezones
release.action: For DateTime and Instant types stored as Timestamp, the database timezone can be driven by parameters on the usertype(s)
For DateTime stored as Timestamp allow the JVM (presentation) zone can be customised from parameters on the usertype
Default presentation (JVM) zone for DateTime is now the JVM zone
Update to JSR 310 0.6.3
Adding initial implementation of new offsetting types for JSR 310
Update to Joda Time 2.0
Resolve issue persisting Joda LocalDateTime to String format
Resolve issue where Joda PersistentDateTimeWithZone cannot be restored from the database reported by Jeffrey Schneller
Resolve issue saving Joda PersistentDateTimeAsString
Resolve issue saving Joda PersistentDateTimeWithZone
Resolve issue saving Joda PersistentDateTimeZoneAsString
Bugfixes for Joda PersistentInterval
Build now performed using Maven 3
Updated JSR 310 support to compile against JSR 310 0.6.2
JSR 310 support now tested against Hibernate 3.6.0.Final
Resolve issue where DateMidnight cannot be restored from the database reported by Nils Hartmann
Resolve issue where only the first column of a multi-column null value was being stored as null

Fix a NullPointerException when using types in HQL suggested by Alison Winters
Link Joda Time 1.6.2
Tracking Hibernate 3.6.0 releases
Link SLF4J 1.6.1
Updated Maven plugin dependencies

Added PersistentDateTimeWithZone to replace previous PersistentDateTime. New PersistentDateTime class persists to a single column without zone.
Modularise build so Joda Time support can be synchronized to central
Update JSR 310 support to Hibernate 3.5.2

Refactored package names and added unit tests
